alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - A thunderstorm producing very heavy rainfall will continue to move across the downtown Charleston area for the next 30 minutes to an hour. Radar estimates and rain gauge reports indicate that rainfall rates are as high as 2 inches per hour. Flooding of roadways is ongoing or will begin shortly across the Charleston peninsula. Other impacted areas could include West Ashley along Highway 17 as well as Mount Pleasant. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, James Island, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, James Island County Park, Charles Towne Landing, Maybank Bridge, Charleston Naval Complex, Sullivans Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre and Stiles Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
